title: No scoped type hierarchy on binary projects
description: When I navigate to the type hierarchy of 'org.apache.ant' in a binary project (e.g. org.apache.ant), I receive the following message: 'No declaration of selected members in the chosen hierarchy of 'org.apache.ant'.' I would expect to see the class hierarchies of the internal jars. Could you please explain the meaning of this message?
OB: When I hit F4 on a binary project selection (e.g. org.apache.ant), I receive the message 'No declaration of selected members in the chosen hierarchy of 'org.apache.ant'.'
EB: When I hit F4 on a binary project selection (e.g. org.apache.ant), I expect to see the class hierarchies of the internal jars of 'org.apache.ant.'
SR:
1. Open a binary project (e.g. org.apache.ant). 
2. Select 'org.apache.ant' in the project. 
3. Press F4 to navigate to the type hierarchy.
